author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Middle Tennessee Falls to New Mexico State 61-57 Despite Comeback
text:
Middle Tennessee Falls to New Mexico State 61-57 Despite Comeback
The
New Mexico State Aggies defeated Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders 61-57 in a tightly contested game, ending the Aggies' three-game losing streak. Middle Tennessee struggled offensively, making only 11-of-28 field goals in the first half and trailing at halftime 35-26. Despite late-game efforts, including a 19-point performance from Camryn Weston, the Blue Raiders failed to score in the final 3:51 of the game. New Mexico State dominated the paint, outscoring Middle Tennessee 42-22 inside and securing 16 second-chance points.
- Middle Tennessee scored just 22 points in the paint compared to New Mexico State's 42.
- Camryn Weston scored a game-high 19 points and contributed 6 rebounds.
- New Mexico State had +13 second-chance points over Middle Tennessee.
Despite a valiant second-half comeback attempt, Middle Tennesseeâ€™s offensive struggles and high turnover rate limited their effectiveness, particularly in critical moments as they failed to capitalize on scoring opportunities in the closing minutes.State of Play
- The Blue Raiders are now 14-7 overall and 5-3 in Conference USA.
- New Mexico State improves to 12-9 and matches Middle Tennessee's conference record at 5-3.
The Blue Raiders will face UTEP, another top team in Conference USA, on Saturday at 2:00 p.m. This matchup will be critical for positioning in the league standings.Bottom Line
Middle Tennessee must address its scoring inefficiencies and turnovers to compete effectively going forward, particularly with a tough upcoming schedule ahead.
